Statement 1- Histopathological examination of a patient with flaccid bulla and painful erosions showing suprabasal blister and inflammatory infiltrate in the blister cleft is seen in pemphigus vulgaris. Statement 2- Row of tombstones appearance is diagnostic of Pemphigus vulgaris.

options.label: A
options.text: Statement 1 is true and Statement 2 is false

options.label: B
options.text: Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is true

options.label: C
options.text: Both the statements are true and 2 is the correct explanation of 1

options.label: D
options.text: Both the statements are true but 2 is not the correct explanation of 1

questions.correct_answer: D. Both the statements are true but 2 is not the correct explanation of 1
